isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - INSPECTION OF FLYWHEEL/ENGINE HOUSING

step1.para: Inspect the flywheel. If it is heat checked or warped, it is recommended to re-face the flywheel ( Figure 20).
Inspect the mating faces of the transmission clutch housing and the engine flywheel housing ( Figure 21). Any appreciable wear on either housing will cause misalignment.
Most wear is found on the lower half of the facings between the 3 and 8 o'clock positions ( Figure 22). Replace housing if worn.

Secure the dial indicator to engine flywheel or crankshaft, and place the gauge finger against the housing pilot ( Figure 23). Rotate the flywheel by hand, marking the high and low points with chalk or soapstone. Total indicated difference between high and low points must NOT EXCEED .008".

figure.caption: Figure 21. Inspect Mating Surfaces of Transmission Clutch Housing and Engine Flywheel Housing
Figure 22. Most Wear Found Between 3 and 8 O'Clock Positions
Figure 23. Secure Dial Indicator to Engine Flywheel or Crankshaft and Place Gauge Finger Against Housing Pilot

step1.para: Now move the gauge finger to contact the face of the engine flywheel housing ( Figure 24). Rotate the flywheel and mark high and low points. Total runout should not exceed .008".

Next, secure the dial indicator to the engine flywheel housing with gauge finger on the face of the flywheel near the center ( Figure 25). Rotate flywheel. Maximum allowable runout is .0005" per inch of flywheel diameter. For example, .007" runout is allowable for a 14" clutch.

Now move the gauge finger to contact the pilot bearing bore surface ( Figure 26). Rotate flywheel. Maximum allowable runout is .005". Exceeding these limits causes misalignment. If not corrected misalignment causes premature wear of drivetrain components.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Move Gauge Finger to Contact Face of Engine Flywheel Housing
Figure 25. Secure Dial Indicator to Engine Flywheel Housing With Gauge Finger on Face of Flywheel Near Center
Figure 26. Move Gauge Finger to Contact Pilot Bearing Bore Surface
